heading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
subHeading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
arabic:
اٰمَنَ الرَّسُوۡلُ بِمَاۤ اُنۡزِلَ اِلَیۡہِ مِنۡ رَّبِّہٖ وَ الۡمُؤۡمِنُوۡنَ ؕ کُلٌّ اٰمَنَ بِاللّٰہِ وَ مَلٰٓئِکَتِہٖ وَ کُتُبِہٖ وَ رُسُلِہٖ ۟ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَیۡنَ اَحَدٍ مِّنۡ رُّسُلِہٖ ۟ وَ قَالُوۡا سَمِعۡنَا وَ اَطَعۡنَا ٭۫ غُفۡرَانَکَ رَبَّنَا وَ اِلَیۡکَ الۡمَصِیۡرُ ﴿۲۸۵﴾ لَا يُكَلِّفُ اللهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَاْ لَهَامَا
كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ رَبَّنَالا
تُوَاخِذُنَا إِنْ تَّسِيْنَا أوْ اَخْطَأْناً رَبَنَاوَلا
تَحْيِلُ عَلَيْنَآ اِصْرًاكَمَا حَمَلْتَهَ عَلَى
انَّذِيْنَ مِنْ قَبْلِنَا رَبَنَاوَلَا تُحَتِّلْنَا مَالَا
طَاقَةًَ لَنَابِهِ وَاعْفُ عَنَّا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَاٌ وَ
ارْحَمْنَا أَنْتَ مَوْلينَا فَانْصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ
الْكُفِرِ يْنَ
translation: The Messenger believes in what has been send down to him from his Lord, and so do the believers. Each one believes in Allah, His Angels, His Books, and His Messengers. They say: ""We make no distinction between any of His Messengers,"" and they say: ""We hear, and we obey. (We seek) Your Forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the return."" Allah burdens not a person beyond what he can bear. He gets reward for that (good) which he has earned, and he is punished for that (evil) which he has earned. Our Lord! Punish us not if we forget or fall into error. Our Lord! Lay not on us a burden like that which You did lay on those before us. Our Lord! Put not on us a burden greater than we have strength to bear. Pardon us and grant us forgiveness. Have mercy on us. You are our Protector, and help us against the disbelieving people.
refText: These two Verses will be sufficient for anyone who recites them at night before sleeping. Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari.

heading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
subHeading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
arabic: اللّٰھُمَّ بِاسْمِکَ اَمُوْتُ وَاَحْیَا
translation: In Your Name , O Allah , I die and I live.
refText: Here, dying and living are metaphors for sleep and wakefulness. This explains why the normal order of these words has been reversed in this Hadith. In other contexts the living is mentioned before dying.

heading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
subHeading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنَّکَ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِیْ وَاَنْتَ تَوَفَّاھَا، لَکَ مَمَاتُھَا وَمَحْیَاھَا اِنْ اَحْیَیْتَھَا فَاحْفَظْھَا وَاِنْ اَمَتَّھَا فَاغْفِرْلَھَا، اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَسْئَلُکَ الْعَافِیَۃَ
translation: O Allah, You have created my soul and You take it back. Unto You is its death and its life . If You give it life then protect it , and if You cause it to die then forgive it. O Allah, I ask You for strength.
refText: Before you go to bed perform ablutions as you would for prayer, then lie down on your right side and say:The Prophet (SAW) said: ""Whoever says this and dies in his sleep, has died in a state of the natural monotheism (Fitrah)."" Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari

heading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
subHeading: Supplications at the time of sleeping
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِیْٓ اِلَیْکَ وَفَوَّضْتُ اَمْرِیْٓ اِلَیْکَ وَوَجَّھْتُ وَجْھِیْ اِلَیْکَ وَاَلْجَاتُ ظَھْرِیْ اِلَیْکَ، رَغْبَۃً وَّرَھْبَۃً اِلَیْکَ لَا مَلْجَاَ وَلَا مَنْجَاَ مِنْکَ اِلَّآ اِلَیْکَ اٰمَنْتُ بِکِتَابِکَ الَّذِیْٓ اَنْزَلْتَ وَبِنَبِیِّکَ الَّذِیْٓ اَرْسَلْتَ
translation: O Allah,1 I submit myself to You, entrust my affairs to You, turn my face to You, and lay myself down depending upon You , hoping in You and fearing You . There is no refuge , and no escape, except to You. I believe in Your Book (the Qur'an) that You revealed, and the Prophet whom You sent.

heading: Supplications at the time of awakening
subHeading: Supplications at the time of awakening
arabic: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰہِ الَّذِیْٓ اَحْیَانَا بَعْدَ مَآ اَمَاتَنَا وَاِلَیْہِ النُّشُوْرُ
translation: Praise is to Allah Who gives us life after He has caused us to die and to Him is the return.

heading: Supplications at the time of awakening
subHeading: Supplications at the time of awakening
arabic: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰہِ الَّذِیْٓ عَافَانِیْ فِیْ جَسَدِیْ وَرَدَّ عَلَیَّ رُوْحِیْ وَاَذِنَ لِیْ بِذِکْرِہٖ
translation: Praise is to Allah Who gave strength to my body and returned my soul to me and permitted me to remember Him.

heading: Supplication before entering Lavatory
arabic: بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنَ الْخُبْثِ وَالْخَبَآئِثِ
translation: (Before entering) [In the Name of Allah] . (Then) O Allah , I seek protection in You from the male and female unclean spirits.
refText: The addition of Bismillah at its beginning was reported by Said bin Mansur. See Fathul-Bari

heading: Supplication when exiting Lavatory
arabic: غُفْرَانَکَ
translation: I seek Your forgiveness.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmithi. An-Nasa'i recorded it in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah. Also see the checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad,

heading: Supplication to Enter mosque
arabic: عُوْذُ بِاللّٰہِ الْعَظِیْمِ وَبِوَجْھِہِ الْکَرِیْمِ وَسُلْطَانِہِ الْقَدِیْمِ مِنَ الشَّیْطَانِ الرَّجِیْمِ بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ وَالصَّلٰوۃُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلٰی رَسُوْلِ اللّٰہِ اَللّٰھُمَّ افْتَحْ لِیْ اَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِکَ
translation: I seek refuge in Almighty Allah, by His Noble Face, by His primordial power, from Satan the outcast.1 [In the Name of Allah, and blessings.]2 [And peace be upon the Messenger of Allah.]3 O Allah, open before me the doors of Your mercy.4
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmithi. An-Nasa'i recorded it in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah. Also see the checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad,

heading: Supplication when leaving mosque
arabic: بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ وَالصَّلٰوۃُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلٰی رَسُوْلِ اللّٰہِ اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَسْئَلُکَ مِنْ فَضْلِکَ اَللّٰھُمَّ اعْصِمْنِیْ مِنَ الشَّیْطَانِ الرَّجِیْم
translation: In the Name of Allah, and peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah, I ask for Your favor, O Allah, protect me from Satan the outcast.

heading: Supplication before ablution
arabic: بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ
translation: In the Name of Allah
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, 'Irwa'ul-Ghain

heading: Supplication after ablution
arabic: اَشْھَدُ اَنْ لَّآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَحْدَہٗ لَاشَرِیْکَ لَہٗ وَاَشْھَدُ اَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُہٗ وَرَسُوْلُہٗ
translation: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.

heading: Supplication and recitation of Durood after Azan
subHeading: Supplication and recitation of Durood after Azan
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ رَبَّ ھٰذِہِ الدَّعْوَۃِ التَّآمَّۃِ وَالصَّلٰوۃِ الْقَآئِمَۃِ اٰتِ مُحَمَّدَ ۨ  الْوَسِیْلَۃَ وَالْفَضِیْلَۃَ وَابْعَثْہُ مَقَامًا مَّحْمُودَ  ۨ الَّذِیْ وَعَدْتَّہٗ (اِنَّکَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِیْعَادَ)
translation: After replying to the call of Mu'aththin. you should recite in Arabic Allah's blessings on the Prophet.O Allah , Lord of this perfect call and established prayer. Grant Muhammad the intercession and favor, and raise him to the honored station You have promised him, [verily You do not neglect promises].
refText: Al-Bukhari and the addition between brackets is from Al-Bayhaqi 1/410 with a good (Hasan) chain of narration. See 'Abdul-Azlz bin Baz's Tuhfatul-'Akhyar,

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: اَللّٰہُ اَکْبَرُ
translation: Allah is the Greatest

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اَعِنِّیْ عَلٰی ذِکْرِکَ وَشُکْرِکَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِکَ

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَحْدَہٗ لَاشَرِیْکَ لَہٗ، لَہُ الْمُلْکُ وَلَہُ الْحَمْدُ وَھُوَ عَلٰی کُلِّ شَیْئٍ قَدِیْرٌ  اَللّٰھُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَآ اَعْطَیْتَ وَلَا مُعْطِیَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ وَلَا یَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْکَ الْجَدُّ
translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld; and the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَحْدَہٗ لَا شَرِیْکَ لَہٗ، لَہُ الْمُلْکُ وَلَہُ الْحَمْدُ وَھُوَ عَلٰی کُلِّ شَیْئٍ قَدِیْرٌ،لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّۃَ اِلَّا بِاللّٰہِ، لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَلَا نَعْبُدُ اِلَّآ اِیَّاہُ، لَہُ النِّعْمَۃُ وَلَہُ الْفَضْلُ وَلَہُ الثَّنَآئُ الْحَسَنُ لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ مُخْلِصِیْنَ لَہُ الدِّیْنَ وَلَوْکَرِہَ الْکَافِرُوْنَ
translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things. There is no power and no might except by Allah . None has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and we do not worship any other besides Him . His is grace , and His is bounty

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: سُبْحَانَ اﷲِ، (33) مرتبہ،  اَلْحَمْدُلِلّٰہِ، (33) مرتبہ،  اَللّٰہُ اَکْبَرُ(33) مرتبہ،  (ایک مرتبہ)  لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَحْدَہٗ لَاشَرِیْکَ لَہٗ، لَہُ الْمُلْکُ وَلَہُ الْحَمْدُ وَھُوَ عَلٰی کُلِّ شَیْئٍ قَدِیْرٌ
translation: Glory is to Allah , and praise is to Allah , and Allah is the Most Great (each said thirty-three times). None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.
refText: Whoever says this after every prayer will be forgiven his sins even though they be as the foam of the sea

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: َللّٰہُ لَاۤ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا ہُوَۚ اَلۡحَیُّ الۡقَیُّوۡمُ  ۬ ۚ لَا تَاۡخُذُہٗ سِنَۃٌ وَّ لَا نَوۡمٌ ؕ لَہٗ مَا فِی السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ مَا فِی الۡاَرۡضِ ؕ مَنۡ ذَا الَّذِیۡ یَشۡفَعُ  عِنۡدَہٗۤ  اِلَّا بِاِذۡنِہٖ ؕ یَعۡلَمُ مَا بَیۡنَ اَیۡدِیۡہِمۡ وَ مَا خَلۡفَہُمۡ  ۚ وَ لَا یُحِیۡطُوۡنَ بِشَیۡءٍ مِّنۡ عِلۡمِہٖۤ اِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ کُرۡسِیُّہُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ الۡاَرۡضَ ۚ وَ لَا یَئُوۡدُہٗ حِفۡظُہُمَا ۚ وَ ہُوَ الۡعَلِیُّ  الۡعَظِیۡمُ
translation: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? He knows what happens to them in this
refText: An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah  also Ibn As-Sunni ( See also Al-Albani, Sahihul and Silsilatul-Ahadith As-Sahihah
refChapter: Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/339 and Silsilatul-Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/697 (no. 972).

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَحْدَہٗ لَاشَرِیْکَ لَہٗ، لَہُ الْمُلْکُ وَلَہُ الْحَمْدُ یُحْیٖ وَیُمِیْتُ وَھُوَ عَلٰی کُلِّ شَیْئٍ قَدِیْرٌ
translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise . He brings life and He causes death , and He is Able to do all things. (Recite ten times in Arabic after the Maghrib and Fajr prayers.)
refText: At-Tirmithi . See its checking in Ibn Al-Qayyim Al-Jawziyyah's Zadul-Ma'ad

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَسْئَلُکَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا وَّرِزْقًا طَیِّبًا وَّعَمَلًا مُّتَقَبَّلًا
translation: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit , a good provision , and deeds that will be accepted. (Recite in Arabic after the Fajr prayer.)
refText: Ibn Majah and others. See Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah and Majma'uz-Zawd'id
refChapter: Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/152 and Majma'uz-Zawd'id 10/111.

heading: Supplication after Tasleem
arabic: اَسْتَغْفِرُاللّٰہَ، اَسْتَغْفِرُاللّٰہَ، اَسْتَغْفِرُاللّٰہَ، اَللّٰھُمَّ اَنْتَ السَّلَامُ وَمِنْکَ السَّلَامُ تَبَارَکْتَ یَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْاِکْرَامِ
translation: I seek the forgiveness of Allah (three times) . O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace . Blessed are You , O Owner of majesty and honor.

heading: Supplication of Vitr (Qunut)
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اھْدِنِیْ فِیْمَنْ ھَدَیْتَ وَعَافِنِیْ فِیْمَنْ عَافَیْتَ وَتَوَلَّنِیْ فِیْمَنْ تَوَلَّیْتَ وَبَارِکْ لِیْ فِیْمَآ اَعْطَیْتَ وَقِنِیْ شَرَّ مَا قَضَیْتَ فَاِنَّکَ تَقْضِیْ وَلَا یُقْضٰی عَلَیْکَ اِنَّہٗ لَا یَذِلُّ مَنْ وَّالَیْتَ (وَلَا یَعِزُّ مَنْ عَادَیْتَ) تَبَارَکْتَ رَبَّنَا وَتَعَالَیْتَ
translation: O Allah , guide me with those whom You have guided , and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength. Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care. Bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil You have ordained. Surely, You command and are not commanded
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, Ahmad, Ad-Darimi, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi Sahih Ibn Majah  and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW.
refChapter: Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/144, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW. 2/ 172.

heading: Supplication of Vitr (Qunut)
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَعُوْذُ بِرِضَاکَ مِنْ سَخَطِکَ وَبِمُعَافَاتِکَ مِنْ عُقُوْبَتِکَ وَاَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنْکَ، لَآ اُحْصِیْ ثَنَآئً عَلَیْکَ اَنْتَ کَمَآ اَثْنَیْتَ عَلٰی نَفْسِکَ
translation: O Allah , I seek refuge with Your Pleasure from Your anger . I seek refuge in Your forgiveness from Your punishment . I seek refuge in You from You . I cannot count Your praises , You are as You have praised Yourself.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, Ahmad. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi  Sahih Ibn Majah  and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil.

heading: Supplication after performing Vitr
arabic: سُبْحَانَ الْمَلِکِ الْقُدُّوْسِ
translation: Glory is to the King, the Holy. [Recite three times in Arabic, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say . . .]

heading: Supplication after performing Vitr
arabic: رَبُّ الْمَلَآئِکَۃِ وَالرُّوْحِ
translation: Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
refText: The final addition is from Ad-Daraqutni's version  and its chain of narration is authentic. See the checking of Zadul-Ma'ad by Shu'aib Al-Arna'ut and 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut

heading: Invocation seeking help from Allah
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَسْتَخِیْرُکَ بِعِلْمِکَ وَاَسْتَقْدِرُکَ بِقُدْرَتِکَ وَاَسْئَلُکَ مِنْ فَضْلِکَ الْعَظِیْمِ فَاِنَّکَ تَقْدِرُ وَلَآ اَقْدِرُ وَتَعْلَمُ وَلَآ اَعْلَمُ وَاَنْتَ عَلَّامُ الْغُیُوْبِ، اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنْ کُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ اَنَّ ھٰذَا الْاَمْرَ خَیْرٌ لِّیْ فِیْ دِیْنِیْ وَمَعَاشِیْ وَعَاقِبَۃِ اَمْرِیْ فَاقْدُرْہُ لِیْ وَیَسِّرْہُ لِیْ ثُمَّ بَارِکْ لِیْ فِیْہِ وَاِنْ کُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ اَنَّ ھٰذَا الْاَمْرَ شَرٌّ لِّیْ فِیْ دِیْنِیْ وَمَعَاشِیْ وَعَاقِبَۃِ اَمْرِیْ فَاصْرِفْہُ عَنِّیْ وَاصْرِفْنِیْ عَنْہُ وَاقْدُرْ لِیَ الْخَیْرَ حَیْثُ کَانَ ثُمَّ اَرْضِنِیْ بِہٖ
translation: O Allah, I seek the counsel of Your Knowledge, and I seek the help of Your Omnipotence, and I beseech You for Your Magnificent Grace. Surely, You are Capable and I am not. You know and I know not, and You are the Knower of the unseen. O Allah, if You know that this matter [then mention the thing to be decided]

heading: Supplications of prostration after recitation
arabic: سَجَدَ وَجْھِیَ لِلَّذِیْ خَلَقَہٗ وَشَقَّ سَمْعَہٗ وَبَصَرَہٗ بِحَوْلِہٖ وَقُوَّتِہٖ فَتَبٰرَکَ اللّٰہُ اَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِیْنَ

heading: Supplications of prostration after recitation
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اَکْتُبْ لِیْ بِھَا عِنْدَکَ اَجْرًا وَّضَعْ عَنِّیْ بِھَا وِزْرًا وَّاجْعَلْھَا لِیْ عِنْدَکَ ذُخْرًا وَّتَقَبَّلْھَا مِنِّیْ کَمَا تَقَبَّلْتَھَا مِنْ عَبْدِکَ دَاوٗدَ

heading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
subHeading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
arabic: حَسْبِیَ اللّٰہُ لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا ھُوَ عَلَیْہِ تَوَکَّلْتُ وَھُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِیْمِ
translation: Allah is sufficient for me . There is none worthy of worship but Him . I have placed my trust in Him, He is Lord of the Majestic Throne . (Recite seven times in Arabic .)
refText: Allah will grant whoever recites this seven times in the morning or evening whatever he desires from this world or the next, Ibn As-Sunni  Both reports are attributed directly to the Prophet  The chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Ibn As-Sunni.

heading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
subHeading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
arabic: بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ الَّذِیْ لَا یَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِہٖ شَیْئٌ فِی الْاَرْضِ وَلَا فِی السَّمَآئِ وَھُوَ السَّمِیْعُ الْعَلِیْمُ
translation: In the Name of Allah, Who with His Name nothing can cause harm in the earth nor in the heavens, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. (Recite three times in Arabic).
refText: Whoever recites it three times in the morning will not be afflicted by any calamity before evening, and whoever recites it three times in the evening will not be overtaken by any calamity before morning."" Abu Dawud 4/323, At-Tirmithi 5/465, Ibn Majah 2/332, Ahmad. Ibn Majah's chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.

heading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
subHeading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
arabic: اَعُوْذُ بِکَلِمَاتِ للّٰہِ التَّآمَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created. (Recite three times in Arabic in the evening .)
refText: Whoever recites this three times in the evening will be protected from insect stings, Ahmad  An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah At-Tirmithi  Ibn As-Sunni no. 68. According to Al-Albani, Ibn Majah's  chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), and following Ibn Baz -Tirmithi's report is good (Hasan).
refChapter: Ibn Majah's (2/266) chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), and following Ibn Baz 45, At-Tirmithi's report is good (Hasan).

heading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
subHeading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
arabic: رَضِیْتُ بِاللّٰہِ رَبًّا وَّبِالْاِسْلَامِ دِیْنًا وَّبِمُحَمَّدٍ نَبِیًّا
translation: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion and with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as my Prophet. (Recite three times in Arabic .)
refText: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion and with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as my Prophet. (Recite three times in Arabic .)
refChapter: Ahmad 4/ 337, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 4, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 68), At-Tirmithi 5/465. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.

heading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
subHeading: Supplications and prayers of Morning and Evening
arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللّٰہِ وَبِحَمْدِہٖ عَدَدَ خَلْقِہٖ وَرِضَا نَفْسِہٖ، وَزِنَۃَ عَرْشِہٖ وَمِدَادَ کَلِمَاتِہٖ
translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His Pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His Words. (Recite three times in Arabic upon rising in the morning .)
refText: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His Pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His Words. (Recite three times in Arabic upon rising in the morning .)

heading: Supplication for solving Problems/Troubles
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ لَا سَھْلَ اِلَّا مَا جَعَلْتَہٗ سَھْلًا وَّاَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزَنَ اِذَا شِئْتَ سَھْلًا
translation: O Allah, there is no ease other than what You make easy. If You please You ease sorrow.
refText: Ibn Hibban in his Sahih  and Ibn As- Sunni  Al-Hafidh (Ibn Hajar) said that this Hadith is authentic. It was also declared authentic by 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-Athkarp.
refChapter: Ibn Hibban in his Sahih (no. 2427), and Ibn As- Sunni (no. 351).

heading: Supplications upon anxiety/depression
arabic: لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ الْعَظِیْمُ الْحَلِیْمُ، لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِیْمِ، لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ رَبُّ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَرَبُّ الْاَرْضِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْکَرِیْمِ
translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah the Mighty, the Forbearing. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, and Lord of the Noble Throne.

heading: Supplications upon anxiety/depression
arabic: َللّٰھُمَّ رَحْمَتَکَ اَرْجُوْ فَلَا تَکِلْنِیْ اِلٰی نَفْسِیْ طَرْفَۃَ عَیْنٍ وَّاَصْلِحْ لِیْ شَاْنِیْ کُلَّہٗ لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّآ اَنْتَ
translation: O Allah , I hope for Your mercy . Do not leave me to myself even for the blinking of an eye (i.e. a moment) . Correct all of my affairs for me . There is none worthy of worship but You.
refText: Abu Dawud / Ahmad  Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud

heading: Supplications upon anxiety/depression
arabic: اَللّٰہُ اَللّٰہُ رَبِّیْ لَآ اُشْرِکُ بِہٖ شَیْئًا
translation: Allah, Allah is my Lord. I do not associate anything with Him.
refText: Abu Dawud . See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mdjah
refChapter: Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/959.

heading: Supplications to be free from debts/loans
subHeading: Supplications to be free from debts/loans
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اکْفِنِیْ بِحَلَالِکَ عَنْ حَرَامِکَ وَاَغْنِنِیْ بِفَضْلِکَ عَمَّنْ سِوَاکَ
translation: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden , and make me independent of all others besides You.
refText: At-Tirmith See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi
refChapter: At-Tirmithi 5/560. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/180.

heading: Supplications to be free from debts/loans
subHeading: Supplications to be free from debts/loans
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنَ الْھَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْکَسَلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَضَلَعِ الدَّیْنِ وَغَلَبَۃِ الرِّجَالِ
translation: O Allah , I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i .e . others) .

heading: Supplications to be free from debts/loans
subHeading: Supplications to be free from debts/loans
arabic: َللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَاَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنْ فِتْنَۃِ الْمَسِیْحِ الدَّجَّالِ وَاَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنْ فِتْنَۃِ الْمَحْیَا وَالْمَمَاتِ، اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنَ الْمَاْثَمِ وَالْمَغْرَمِ
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and I seek refuge in You from the trial of the False Messiah, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of life and death. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from sin and from debt.

heading: Supplication to ask substitute upon difficulties
subHeading: Supplication to ask substitute upon difficulties
arabic: ِنَّا لِلّٰہِ وَاِنَّا اِلَیْہِ رَاجِعُوْنَ اَللّٰھُمَّ اُجُرْنِیْ فِیْ مُصِیْبَتِیْ وَاَخْلِفْ لِیْ خَیْرًا مِّنْھَا

heading: Supplication when in anxiety
arabic: َآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ

heading: Supplication when angry
arabic: اَعُوْذُ بِاللّٰہِ مِنَ الشَّیْطٰنِ الرَّجِیْمِ
translation: (Say:) I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast (then spit to your left). (Do this three times reciting in Arabic.)

heading: Supplication when see a destitute
arabic: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰہِ الَّذِیْ عَافَانِیْ مِمَّا ابْتَلَاکَ بِہٖ وَفَضَّلَنِیْ عَلٰی کَثِیْرٍ مِّمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِیْلًا

heading: Supplication to be safe from polytheism
subHeading: Supplication to be safe from polytheism
arabic: َللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَعُوْذُبِکَ اَنْ اُشْرِکَ بِکَ وَاَنَا اَعْلَمُ وَاسْتَغْفِرُکَ لِمَا لَآ اَعْلَمُ
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I associate anything with You knowingly, and I seek Your forgiveness for what I know not.
refText: Ahmad  See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir  and Sahihut-Targhib wat- Tarhib
refChapter: Ahmad 4/403. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 3/233 and Sahihut-Targhib wat- Tarhib 1/19.

heading: Supplication to ward off bad omen
subHeading: Supplication to ward off bad omen
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ لَا طَیْرَ اِلَّا طَیْرُکَ وَلَا خَیْرَ اِلَّا خَیْرُکَ وَلَآ اِلٰہَ غَیْرُکَ
translation: O Allah there is no portent other than Your portent, no goodness other than Your goodness, and none worthy of worship other than You.
refText: Ahmad  Ibn As-Sunni  See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadlth As-Sahihah  As for bodings of good, these used to please the Prophet (SAW) and so when he heard good words from someone, he used to say: ""We have taken from you a good portent from your mouth,"" Abu Dawud, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah  and it is with Abu Ash-Shaikh Al-Asfahani in 'Akhlaqun-Nabiyy,
refChapter: Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/363, and it is with Abu Ash-Shaikh Al-Asfahani in 'Akhlaqun-Nabiyy, pg. 270.

heading: Supplication after Lunch/Dinner
arabic: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰہِ الَّذِیْٓ اَطْعَمَنِیْ ھٰذَا وَ رَزَقَنِیْہِ مِنْ غَیْرِ حَوْلٍ مِّنِّیْ وَلَا قُوَّۃٍ
translation: Praise is to Allah Who has given me this food and sustained me with it though I was unable to doit and powerless.
refText: At-Tirmithi, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi

heading: Supplication after Lunch/Dinner
arabic: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلّٰہِ حَمْدًا کَثِیْرًا طَیِّبًا مُبَارَکًا فِیْہِ غَیْرَ مَکْفِیٍّ وَّلَا مُوَدَّعٍ وَّلَا مُسْتَغْنًی عَنْہُ رَبَّنَا
translation: All praise is to Allah, praise in abundance, good and blessed . It cannot [be compensated for, nor can it] be left, nor can it be done without , our Lord.

heading: Supplication upon wearing new dress
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ لَکَ الْحَمْدُ اَنْتَ کَسَوْتَنِیْہِ اَسْئَلُکَ، مِنْ خَیْرِہٖ وَخَیْرِ مَا صُنِعَ لَہٗ، وَاَعُوْذُبِکَ مِنْ شَرِّہٖ وَشَرِّ مَا صُنِعَ لَہٗ
translation: O Allah, praise is to You. You have clothed me. I ask You for its goodness and the goodness of what it has been made for, and I seek Your protection from the evil of it and the evil of what it has been made for.
refText: Abu Dawud and At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Mukhtasar Shamd'i

heading: Supplication exiting home
arabic: بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ تَوَکَّلْتُ عَلَی اللّٰہِ لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّۃَ اِلَّا بِاللّٰہِ
translation: In the Name of Allah, I have placed my trust in Allah, there is no might and no power except by Allah.
refChapter: Abu Dawud 4/325, At-Tirmithi 5/490. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/151

heading: Supplication exiting home
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْ اَعُوْذُبِکَ اَنْ اَضِلَّ، اَوْ اُضَلَّ، اَوْ اَزِلَّ، اَوْ اُزَلَّ، اَوْ اَظْلِمَ، اَوْ اُظْلَمَ، اَوْ اَجْھَلَ، اَوْ یُجْھَلَ عَلَّی
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others , or I am misguided by others , lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err , lest I abuse others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi
refChapter: Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/336

heading: Supplication entering home
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَسْئَلُکَ خَیْرَ الْمَوْلِجِ وَخَیْرَ الْمَخْرَجِ، بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ وَلَجْنَا وَبِسْمِ اللّٰہِ خَرَجْنَا، وَعَلَی اللّٰہِ رَبِّنَا تَوَکَّلْنَا
translation: In the Name of Allah we enter , in the Name of Allah we leave , and upon our Lord we depend [then say As-Salaamu 'Alaykum to those present].
refText: Abu Dawud  Muslim says that one should mention the Name of Allah when entering the home and when beginning to eat; and that the devil, hearing this, says: ""There is no shelter for us here tonight and no food.

heading: Supplication entering market
arabic: لَآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا اللّٰہُ وَحْدَہٗ لَاشَرِیْکَ لَہٗ، لَہُ الْمُلْکُ وَلَہُ الْحَمْدُ، یُحْیٖ وَیُمِیْتُ وَھُوَ حَیٌّ لَّا یَمُوْتُ بِیَدِہِ الْخَیْرُ وَھُوَ عَلٰی کُلِّ شَیْئٍ قَدِیْرٌ
translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is living and does not die. In His Hand is all good, and He is Able to do all things.
refText: At-Tirmithi  and Al-Hakim  Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Ibn Majah and Sahih At-Tirmith
refChapter: At-Tirmithi 5/291, and Al-Hakim 1/538. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Ibn Majah 2/21 and Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152.

heading: Supplication upon sight of moon
arabic: اَللّٰہُ اَکْبَرُ، اَللّٰھُمَّ اَھِلَّہٗ عَلَیْنَا بِالْاَمْنِ وَالْاِیْمَانِ وَالسَّلَامَۃِ وَالْاِسْلَامِ وَالتَّوْفِیْقِ لِمَا تُحِبُّ رَبَّنَا وَتَرْضٰی، رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّکَ اللّٰہُ
translation: Allah is the Most Great . O Allah , bring us the new moon with security and Faith, with peace and in Islam, and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
refText: At-Tirmithi  Ad-Darimi  See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi

heading: Supplications at the time of breaking fast (Iftar)
subHeading: Supplications at the time of breaking fast (Iftar)
arabic: ذَھَبَ الظَّمَأُ وَابْتَلَّتِ الْعُرُوْقُ وَثَبَتَ الْاَجْرُ اِنْ شَآئَ اللّٰہُ
translation: The thirst is gone, the veins are moistened and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
refText: Abu Dawud  and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir
refChapter: Abu Dawud 2/306  Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209.

heading: Supplications at the time of breaking fast (Iftar)
subHeading: Supplications at the time of breaking fast (Iftar)
arabic: اَللّٰھُمَّ اِنِّیْٓ اَسْئَلُکَ بِرَحْمَتِکَ الَّتِیْ وَسِعَتْ کُلَّ شِیْئٍ اَنْ تَغْفِرَلِیْ
translation: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things, that You forgive me.
refText: Ibn Majah from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh graded it as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul- Athkar

heading: Supplications before intercourse
arabic: بِسْمِ اللّٰہِ اَللّٰھُمَّ جَنِّبْنَا الشَّیْطَانَ وَجَنِّبِ الشَّیْطَانَ مَا رَزَقْتَنَا
translation: With the Name of Allah. O Allah, keep the I Devil away from us and keep the Devil away from that which You provide for us.

heading: Supplication upon happiness
arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللّٰہِ اَللّٰہُ اَکْبَرُ

heading: Supplication to seek refuge of Allah for children
subHeading: Supplication to seek refuge of Allah for children
arabic: اُعِیْذُ کُمَا بِکَلِمَاتِ اللّٰہِ التَّآمَّۃِ مِنْ کُلِّ شَیْطَانٍ وَّھَآمَّۃٍ وَّمِنْ کُلِّ عَیْنِ لَّآمَّۃٍ
translation: I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allah from every devil and every beast , and from every envious blameworthy eye.

heading: Supplication at the end of gathering
subHeading: Supplication at the end of gathering
arabic: سُبْحَانَکَ اللّٰھُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِکَ اَشْھَدُ اَنْ لَّآ اِلٰہَ اِلَّآ اَنْتَ اَسْتَغْفِرُکَ وَاَتُوْبُ اِلَیْکَ
translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise is to You. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi and An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi . Aishah (RA) said: ""Allah's Messenger (SAW) did not sit in a gathering, and did not recite the Qur'an, and did not perform any prayer without concluding by saying ... (then she quoted the above)."" This was reported by An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah  and Dr. Farooq Hamadah graded it authentic in his checking of the same book, See also Ahmad

heading: Ayat ul Kursi
arabic: اَللّٰہُ لَاۤ اِلٰہَ اِلَّا ہُوَۚ اَلۡحَیُّ الۡقَیُّوۡمُ ۬ ۚ لَا تَاۡخُذُہٗ سِنَۃٌ وَّ لَا نَوۡمٌ ؕ لَہٗ مَا فِی السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ مَا فِی الۡاَرۡضِ ؕ مَنۡ ذَا الَّذِیۡ یَشۡفَعُ  عِنۡدَہٗۤ  اِلَّا بِاِذۡنِہٖ ؕ یَعۡلَمُ مَا بَیۡنَ اَیۡدِیۡہِمۡ وَ مَا خَلۡفَہُمۡ  ۚ وَ لَا یُحِیۡطُوۡنَ بِشَیۡءٍ مِّنۡ عِلۡمِہٖۤ اِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ کُرۡسِیُّہُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَ الۡاَرۡضَ ۚ وَ لَا یَـُٔوۡدُہٗ حِفۡظُہُمَا ۚ وَ ہُوَ الۡعَلِیُّ  الۡعَظِیۡمُ ﴿۲۵۵﴾
translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

heading: Supplication for Protection from Shaitan:
arabic: اَللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ الشَّيْطَانِ وَفِتْنَتِهِ
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the evil of Shaitan and his mischief.
refText: This supplication is found in Sahih Muslim, Book 35, Hadith  It is part of the supplications that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) would use to seek Allah's protection from Shaitan and his evil whispers

heading: Supplication for Guidance
arabic: اهْدِنَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ
translation: Guide us to the Straight Path.
refText: This dua is from Surah Al-Fatiha which is the opening chapter of the Qur'an. It is the first and most important supplication in the daily prayer (Salah), recited in every unit of prayer (Rak'ah).

heading: Supplication  for Forgiveness
arabic: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِي أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَانْصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ
translation: My Lord, forgive me and have mercy on me.
refText: This dua is found in Surah Al-Isra  The full verse, in which Allah addresses His command to worship and honor one's parents, is as follows:

heading: Supplication for Mercy
arabic: رَبِّ رَحْمَتُكَ وَفِرْ لِي
translation: O my Lord, have mercy on me and forgive me.
refText: This supplication is mentioned in Surah Al-A'raf  The verse is part of the context where Allah describes His mercy and forgiveness. The full verse is as follows:

heading: Supplication for Success
arabic: رَبِّ يَسِّرْ وَلا تُعَسِّرْ
translation: My Lord, make it easy and do not make it difficult.
refText: This supplication is found in Sahih Muslim, Book 35, Hadith  (or similar references depending on the edition), where the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) is reported to have used this dua when seeking

heading: Supplication for Health
arabic: اللّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَدَنِي
translation: O Allah, grant me good health.
refText: This dua is found in Sahih Muslim, Book 35, Hadith  (in some versions it may be referenced as Hadith  It is part of the general supplications that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recommended for his followers to make for their well-being.

heading: Supplication for Protection from Hellfire
arabic: اللّهُمَّ قِني عَذَابَ النَّارِ
translation: O Allah, protect me from the punishment of the Fire.
refText: This supplication is found in Sahih Muslim, Book 1, Hadith . Specifically, it is part of the supplications taught by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) to protect oneself from the harms of the Hereafter.

heading: Supplication  for Relief from Worries
arabic: اللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and sorrow.

heading: Supplication  for Strength and Patience
arabic: رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَانْصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ
translation: Our Lord, pour upon us patience, plant firmly our feet, and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

heading: Supplication for Steadfastness on the Path of Allah
subHeading: Supplication for Steadfastness on the Path of Allah
arabic: رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
translation: Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims in submission to You.
refText: This du’a was recited by the magicians who accepted Islam after seeing the miracle of Prophet Musa (peace be upon him).

heading: Supplication for Ease in Affairs
arabic: حَسْبُنَا اللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيلُ
translation: Sufficient for us is Allah, and He is the best Disposer of affairs.

heading: Supplication for Knowledge
arabic: رَبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا
translation: My Lord, increase me in knowledge.

heading: Supplication for Entrance and Exit
arabic: رَبِّ أَدْخِلْنِي مُدْخَلَ صِدْقٍ وَأَخْرِجْنِي مُخْرَجَ صِدْقٍ وَاجْعَلْ لِي مِنْ لَدُنْكَ سُلْطَانًا نَصِيرًا
translation: My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit, and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority.

heading: Supplication for protection during the travel
subHeading: Supplication for protection during the travel
arabic: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ  وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ
translation: Glory is to Him Who has subjected this (transport) to us, and we could not have (otherwise) subdued it. And indeed, to our Lord, we will surely return.

heading: Supplication for Strength Against Trials
arabic: حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ ۖ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation: Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne.

heading: Supplication for Protection from Evil
arabic: وَقُلْ رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِينِوَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ
translation: And say, 'My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils, and I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me.'

heading: Supplication for Relief from Hardship
arabic: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
translation: There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers.

heading: Supplication for leaving the home
arabic: اللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ أَوْ أُزلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَم، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others, or I am misguided by others, lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err, lest Iabuse others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/336

heading: Supplication When wearing a garment
arabic: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي كَسَانِي هَذَا (القَّوْبَ) وَرَزَقَنِيهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلا قُوَّة
translation: All Praise is for Allaah who has clothed me with this [garment] and provided it for me, with no power nor might from myself.
refText: Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi. See also 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 7/47

heading: Supplication When wearing a new garment
subHeading: Supplication When wearing a new garment
arabic: اللهُمَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ أنْتَ كَسَوْتَنِيهِ، أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِهِ وَخَيْرِ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وَشَرِّ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ
translation: O Allaah, for You is all praise, You have clothed me with it, I ask You for the good of it and the good for which it was made, and I seek refugewith You from the evil of it and the evil for which it was made
refText: Abu Dawud and At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Mukhtasar Shamd'il At-Tirmithi, p. 47

heading: Supplication said to someone wearing a new garment
subHeading: Supplication said to someone wearing a new garment
arabic: تُبْلي وَيُخْلِفُ اللهُ تَعَالى
translation: May you wear it out and Allaah (Ta'aala) replace it [with another]
refText: Abu Dawud 4/41. See also Al-Albani Sahih Abu Dawud 2/760.

heading: Supplication Before undressing
arabic: بِسْمِ الله
translation: In the name of Allaah
refText: At-Tirmithi 2/505, among others. See 'Irwa'ul Ghalil no. 49 and Sahihul-Jami' 3/203

heading: Supplication Upon entering the home
arabic: بِسْمِ اللهِ وَلَجْنا، وَبِسْمِ اللهِ خَرَجْنا، وَعَلى رَبِّنا تَوَكّلْنا
translation: In the Name of Allah we enter , in the Name of Allah we leave, and upon our Lord we depend [then say As-Salaamu 'Alaykum to those present].
refText: Abu Dawud 4/325. Muslim {Hadith no. 2018) says that one should mention the Name of Allah when entering the home and when beginning to eat; and that the devil, hearing this, says: 'There is no shelter for us here tonight and no food.

heading: Supplication for settling a debt
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِي بِحَلالِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ وَأَغْنِنِي بِفَضْلِكَ عَمَّنْ سِوَاكَ
translation: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and make me independent of all others besides You.
refText: At-Tirmithi 5/560. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/180

heading: Supplication for settling a debt
arabic: اللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، والعَجْزِ والكَسَلِ والبُخْلِ والجُبْنِ، وضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وغَلَبَةِ الرِّجال
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from | being overcome by debt and from being overpowered by men (i .e. other people).[2]

heading: Supplication During a wind storm
arabic: اللّهُمَّ إِنَّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَها، وَأَعوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّها
translation: O Allah , I ask You for the good of it and seek refuge in You against its evil.[1]
refText: Abu Dawud 4/326, Ibn Majah 2/1228. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mjjah 2/305

heading: Supplication Upon hearing thunder
arabic: سُبْحانَ الّذي يُسَبِّحُ الرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِ، وَالملائِكةُ مِنْ خيفَته
translation: Glory is to Him Whom thunder and angels glorify due to fear of Him.
refText: Abdullah bin Zubair (RA) would hear thunder, he would abandon all conversation and say this supplication. See Al-Muwatta' conversation and say this supplication. See Al-Muwatta' graded authentic by Al-Albani as a statement of Abdullah bin Zubayr only.

heading: Supplication for rain
arabic: اللّهُمَّ اسْقِ عِبادَكَ وَبَهائِمَك، وَانْشُرْ رَحْمَتَكَ وَأَحْيِي بَلَدَكَ المَيِّت
translation: O Allaah, relieve us, O Allaah, relieve us, O Allaah, relieve us.
refText: Abu Dawud 1/305. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/218.

heading: Supplication When it rains
arabic: اللّهُمَّ صَيِّباً نافِعاً
translation: O Allah, (bring) beneficial rain clouds.

heading: Supplication for entering the home
arabic: اللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَِلَّ أَوْ أُزَلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ أَوْ أُظْلَم، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ
translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others, or I am misguided by others, lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err, lest Iabuse others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/336

heading: Supplication After rainfall
arabic: مُطِرْنا بِفَضْلِ اللهِ وَرَحْمَتِه
translation: It has rained by the bounty of Allah and His mercy

heading: Supplication Asking for clear skies
arabic: اللّهُمَّ حَوالَيْنا وَلا عَلَيْنا، اللّهُمَّ عَلى الآكامِ وَالظِّراب، وَبُطونِ الأوْدِية، وَمَنابِتِ الشَّجر
translation: O Allah, let it pass us and not fall upon us, but upon the hills and mountains, and the center of the valleys, and upon the forested lands.

heading: Supplication Upon sighting the crescent moon
subHeading: Supplication Upon sighting the crescent moon
arabic: اللهُ أَكْبَر، اللّهُمَّ أَهِلَّهُ عَلَيْنا بِالأمْنِ وَالإيمان، والسَّلامَةِ والإسْلام، وَالتَّوْفيقِ لِما تُحِبُّ رَبَّنا وَتَرْضى، رَبُّنا وَرَبُّكَ الله
translation: Allah is the Most Great . O Allah, bring us the new moon with security and Faith, with peace and in Islam, and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
refText: At-Tirmithi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/157.

heading: Supplication Upon breaking fast
arabic: ذَهَبَ الظَّمَأُ، وَابْتَلَّتِ العُروق، وَثَبَتَ الأجْرُ إِنْ شاءَ الله
translation: The thirst is gone, the veins are moistened and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
refText: Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209.

heading: Supplication of the guest for the host
subHeading: Supplication of the guest for the host
arabic: اللّهُمَّ بارِكْ لَهُمْ فيما رَزَقْتَهُم، وَاغْفِرْ لَهُمْ وَارْحَمْهُمْ
translation: O Allah, bless them in what You have provided for them, and forgive them and have mercy on them.

heading: Supplication said to one offering a drink or to one who intended to do that
subHeading: Supplication said to one offering a drink or to one who intended to do that
arabic: اللّهُمَّ أَطْعِمْ مَن أَطْعَمَني، وَاسْقِ مَن سقاني
translation: O Allah, feed the one who has fed me and drink to the one who has given me drink.

heading: Supplication said upon seeing the early or premature fruit
subHeading: Supplication said upon seeing the early or premature fruit
arabic: اللّهُمَّ بارِكْ لَنا في ثَمَرِنا، وَبارِكْ لَنا في مَدينَتِنا، وَبارِكْ لَنا في صاعِنا، وَبارِكْ لَنا في مُدِّنا
translation: O Allah, bless us in our dates and bless us in our town, bless us in our Sa' and in our Mudd.
refText: Muslim 2/1000 (Sa' and Mudd are both dry measures used for agricultural produce by the Arabs in the Prophet's time. Of the two, the So.'was the larger measure.)

heading: Supplication Upon sneezing
arabic: الْحَمْدُ للهِ
translation: All praises and thanks are to Allah.

heading: Supplication said to the newlywed
arabic: بارَكَ اللهُ لَك، وَبارَكَ عَلَيْك، وَجَمَعَ بَيْنَكُما في خَيْر
translation: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and join you together in goodness.
refText: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/316.

heading: Supplication The groom's supplication on the wedding night or when buying an animal
subHeading: supplication The groom's supplication on the wedding night or when buying an animal
arabic: اللّهُمَّ إِنَّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَها، وَخَيْرَ ما جَبَلْتَها عَلَيْه، وَأَعوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّها، وَشَرِّ ما جَبَلْتَها عَلَيْه
translation: O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of her and the goodness upon which You have created her, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of her and from the evil upon which You have created her.
refText: Abu Dawud 2/248 and Ibn Majah 1/617. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/324

heading: Supplication Before sexual intercourse
arabic: بِسْمِ الله اللّهُمَّ جَنِّبنا الشَّيْطانَ، وَجَنِّبِ الشَّيْطانَ ما رَزَقْتَنا
translation: With the Name of Allah. O Allah, keep the I Devil away from us and keep the Devil away from that which You provide for us.

heading: Supplication When angry
arabic: أَعوذُ بِاللهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطانِ الرَّجيم
translation: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.

heading: Supplication said upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation
subHeading: Supplication said upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation
arabic: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الّذي عافاني مِمّا ابْتَلاكَ بِهِ، وَفَضَّلَني عَلى كَثيرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضيلا
translation: Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with, and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created.
refText: At-Tirmithi 5/493,4. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/153.

heading: Supplication Remembrance said at a sitting or gathering etc.
subHeading: Supplication Remembrance said at a sitting or gathering etc.
arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لي، وَتُبْ عَلَيَّ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوّابُ الغَفور
translation: My Lord, forgive me and accept my repentance, You are the Ever-Relenting, the All-Forgiving.
refText: Sahih Ibn Majah 2/321. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/153.

heading: Supplication for the expiation of sins said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering etc.
subHeading: Supplication for the expiation of sins said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering etc.
arabic: سُبْحانَكَ اللّهُمَّ وَبِحَمدِك، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ أَنْتَ أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتوبُ إِلَيْك
translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise is to You. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.

heading: Supplication Returning a supplication of forgiveness
subHeading: Supplication Returning a supplication of forgiveness
arabic: غَفَرَ اللهُ لَكَ
translation: May Allaah forgive you, O Messenger of Allaah.'

heading: Supplication said to one who does you a favour
subHeading: Supplication said to one who does you a favour
arabic: جَزاكَ اللهُ خَيْراً
translation: May Allah reward you with good.
refText: At-Tirmithi (no. 2035). See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/200 and Sahihul-Jami' (no. 6244).

heading: Supplication said to one who pronounces his love for you, for Allaah's sake
subHeading: Supplication said to one who pronounces his love for you, for Allaah's sake
arabic: أَحَبَّكَ الّذي أَحْبَبْتَني لَه
translation: May He for Whose sake you love me, love you.
refText: Abu Dawud 4/333. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/965.

heading: Supplication What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news
subHeading: Supplication What to say upon receiving pleasing or displeasing news
arabic: الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذي بِنعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصّالِحات
translation: Praise is to Allah Who by His blessings all good things are perfected.
refText: Ibn As-Sunni, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic 1/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/201.

heading: Supplication said for one you have insulted
subHeading: Supplication said for one you have insulted
arabic: اللهُمَّ فأَيُّمَا مُؤْمِنٍ سَبَبْتُهُ فَاجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ لهُ قُرْبةً إليكَ يَوْمَ القِيَامةِ
translation: O Allah, whomever of the believers I have abused, give him the reward of a sacrificial slaughter for it on the Day of Resurrection.
refText: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/171, Muslim 4/2007. The wording in Muslim's report is: 'make it a purification for him and a source of mercy.

heading: Supplication What to say when startled
subHeading: Supplication What to say when startled
arabic: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللهُ
translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah!

heading: Supplication For Iftaar Fasting
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْتُ وَعَلَى رِزْقِكَ أَفْطَرْتُ
translation: O Allah, I fasted for You and broke my fast with Your provisions.

heading: Dua for Rizq
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا
translation: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, goodly provision and acceptable deeds

heading: Hajat ki Dua/Dua e Hajat in Arabic
subHeading: Hajat ki Dua/Dua e Hajat in Arabic
arabic: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْحَلِيمُ الْكَرِيمُ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ، الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ،أَسْأَلُكَ مُوجِبَاتِ رَحْمَتِكَ، وَعَزَائِمَ مَغْفِرَتِكَ، وَالْغَنِيمَةَ مِنْ كُلِّ بِرٍّ،وَالسَّلَامَةَ مِنْ كُلِّ إِثْمٍ،لَا تَدَعْ لِي ذَنْبًا إِلَّا غَفَرْتَهُ،وَلَا هَمًّا إِلَّا فَرَّجْتَهُ،وَلَا حَاجَةً هِيَ لَكَ رِضًا إِلَّا قَضَيْتَهَا يَا أَرْحَمَ الرَّاحِمِينَ
translation: None has the right to be worshiped but Allah. Al-Halim (the Forbearing) Al-Karim (the Generous). Glorious is Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne. All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds. I ask You for that which warrants Your mercy, and that which will determine Your forgiveness, and the spoils (fruits) of every righteous deed, and safety from every sin; do not leave a sin for me without forgiving it, nor a worry without relieving it. Or a need that pleases you without granting it. O Most-Merciful of those who have mercy.

heading: Dua after Azan
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلَاةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ
translation: O Allah! Lord of this perfect call and of the regular prayer which is going to be established, give Muhammad(ﷺ) the authority of intercession and illustriousness, and raise him to the greatest and highest position in Paradise that You promised him.

heading: What is said to a kaafir when he sneezes
subHeading: What is said to a kaafir when he sneezes
arabic: يَهْديكُمُ اللهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بالَكُم
translation: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.
refText: At-Tirmithi 5/82, Ahmad 4/400, Abu Dawud 4/ 308. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/354.

heading: Returning a greeting to a kaafir
subHeading: Returning a greeting to a kaafir
arabic: وَعَلَيْكُمْ
translation: And upon you.

heading: When insulted while fasting
arabic: إنِّي صَائِمٌ , إنِّي صَائِمٌ
translation: I am fasting . I am fasting.

heading: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice
subHeading: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice
arabic: بِسْمِ اللهِ واللهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ ولَكَ اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنِّي
translation: With the Name of Allah, Allah is the Most Great! [O Allah, from You and to You.] O Allah, accept it from me.

heading: When visiting the sick
arabic: أَسْأَلُ اللهَ العَظيم، رَبَّ العَرْشِ العَظيم أَنْ يَشْفيك. (سبع مرات)
translation: I ask Almighty Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, to make you well. (Recite seven times in Arabic.
refText: At-Tirmithi, Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/210 and Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/180.

heading: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life
subHeading: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life
arabic: اللّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لي وَارْحَمْني وَأَلْحِقْني بِالرَّفيقِ الأَعْلى
translation: O Allah, forgive me and have mercy upon me and join me with the highest companions (in Paradise).

heading: Instruction for the one nearing death
subHeading: Instruction for the one nearing death
arabic: لا إلهَ إلاّ الله
translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah. ... will enter Paradise.

heading: Supplication for one afflicted by a calamity
subHeading: Supplication for one afflicted by a calamity
arabic: إِنّا للهِ وَإِنَا إِلَيْهِ راجِعون، اللهُمِّ أجُرْني في مُصيبَتي، وَاخْلِفْ لي خَيْراً مِنْها
translation: We are from Allah and unto Him we return . O Allah take me out of my plight and bring to me after it something better.

heading: When closing the eyes of the deceased
subHeading: When closing the eyes of the deceased
arabic: اللهُمِّ اغْفِرْ لِ-فلان باسمه- وَارْفَعْ دَرَجَتَهُ في المَهْدِيين، وَاخْلُفْهُ في عَقِبِهِ في الغابِرين، وَاغْفِرْ لَنا وَلَهُ يا رَبَّ العالَمين، وَافْسَحْ لَهُ في قَبْرِهِ وَنَوِّرْلَهُ فيه
translation: O Allah, forgive [name of the person] and elevate his station among those who are guided. Send him along the path of those who came before, and forgive us and him, O Lord of the worlds. Enlarge for him his grave and shed light upon him in it.

heading: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer
subHeading: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer
arabic: اللهُمِّ عَبْدُكَ وَابْنُ أَمَتِك، احْتاجَ إِلى رَحْمَتِك، وَأَنْتَ غَنِيٌّ عَنْ عَذابِه، إِنْ كانَ مُحْسِناً فَزِدْ في حَسَناتِه، وَإِنْ كانَ مُسيئاً فَتَجاوَزْ عَنْه
translation: O Allah, Your male slave and the child of Your female slave is in need of Your mercy , and You are not in need of his torment . If he was pious then increase his rewards and if he was a transgressor then pardon him .. [4]

heading: Placing children under Allaah's protection
arabic: أُعيذُكُما بِكَلِماتِ اللهِ التّامَة، مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطانٍ وَهامَّة، وَمِنْ كُلِّ عَيْزٍ لامَّة
translation: I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allah from every devil and every beast, and from every envious blameworthy eye.

heading: To ward off the deception of the obstinate Shaytaans
subHeading: To ward off the deception of the obstinate Shaytaans
arabic:
أَعُوذُ بكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُ هُنَّ بَرُّ ولَا فَاجرُ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلقَ، وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ، ومِنْ شَرِّمَا
يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُ جُ فيهَا، ومِن شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ في الأَرْضِ ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُ جُ مِنْهَا، وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ
اللَّيْلِ والنَّهارِ، ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طارِقٍ إِلَّا طَارٍقاً يَطْرُقُ بخَيْرٍ يَارَحْمَنُ
translation:
I take refuge within Allaah's perfect words which no righteous or unrighteous person can transgress, from all the evil that He has created,
made and originated. [I take refuge] from the evil that descends from the sky and the evil that rises up to it. [I take refuge] from the evil that
is spread on earth and the evil that springs from her, and I take refuge from the evil of the tribulations of night and day, and the evil of one
who visits at night except the one who brings good, O Merciful One.'
refText:
Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 637).
Al-'Aqidah At-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127.

Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of

heading: The best dua
arabic: رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
translation: Our Lord! Give us in this world that which is good and in the Hereafter that which is good, and save us from the torment of the Fire!

heading: Dua for knowledge, provision and good deeds
subHeading: Dua for knowledge, provision and good deeds
arabic: اللَّهُمَّاِنِّى أَسْألُكَ عِلْمَاً نَافِعاً وَرِزْقاً طَيِباً وَعَمَلاً مُتَقَبَلاً
translation: O Allah! I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit, a good provision and deeds that will be accepted.

heading: Protection from distress, hardships, calamities
arabic: اللَّهُمّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُبِكَ مِنْ جَهْدِ الْبَلاَءِ، وَدَرَكِ الشَّقَاءِ، وَسُوءِ الْقَضَاءِ، وَشَمَاتَةِ الأَعْدَاءِ
translation: O Allah I seek refuge in YOU from severe calamities and hardships, grips of ill hope, evil destiny and from rejoicing of enemies

heading: Dua for wellness in both worlds
subHeading: Dua for wellness in both worlds
arabic: اللَّهُمَ إِنِيْ أَسْأَلُكَ العَافِيَةَ فِيّ الْدُّنْيَاوَ الْآخِرَةِ
translation: O Allah I ask You wellness in this life and in the hereafter

heading: Dua for protection from any harm, and cure from illness [3 times]
subHeading: Dua for protection from any harm, and cure from illness [3 times]
arabic: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ الله التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
translation: I seek protection in the perfect words of Allah from every evil that He has created.
refText:
Aboo Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrates from the Prophet : "Whoever recites in the evening three times; I seek protection in the perfect words of Allah from every evil that He has created, then not so much as a stinger (humah) will harm him that evening." In Muslim there is a similar wording without mention of reciting the supplication thrice (#2709) and at-Tirmidhee (#3898), and al-'Alaamah Ibn Baaz (may Allah have
mercy upon him) mentioned it in Tuhfat-ul-Akhyaar, saying: "The noun al-Humah denotes an animal that possess a stinger filled with poison like a scorpion,
snake or something similar. And Suhayl bin Saalih who is one of the narrators of this narration said: "Our people had learned this supplication and we used
to recite it every evening when a teenage girl was stung but suffered no pain or affliction (from the sting)". Taken from The Precious Remembrance Written
by ash-Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen

heading: Daily Azkar for protection from any unexpected affliction [recite 3 times]
subHeading: Daily Azkar for protection from any unexpected affliction [recite 3 times]
arabic: بِسْمِ الله الَّذِي لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْئُ فِي الأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِي السَماءِوَهُوَ السَّمِيِعُ العَلِيمُ
translation: In the name of Allah, with Whose name nothing on the earth or in the heavens can cause harm, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing
refText:
Related by Aboo Daawud (#5088) from 'Uthmaan bin 'Afaan (may Allah be pleased with him), and its wording is: I heard the Messenger
of Allah say: "Whoever says three times; In the name of Allah, with Whose Name nothing on the earth or in the heavens can cause harm, He is the All-
Hearing, the All-Knowing, he will not be afflicted with an unexpected affliction until he reaches the morning, and whoever recites it three times upon
entering the morning he will not be afflicted with an unexpected affliction until he reaches the evening." Shaykh al-Albaanee (may Allah have mercy upon
him) authenticated it in Saheeh Abee Daawud (#5088). And it was narrated by Abaan bin 'Uthmaan said: I heard 'Uthmaan bin 'Afaan (may Allah be pleased
with him) said: The Messenger of Allah said: "There is not a slave who recites three times in the morning of every day and in the evening of every night; In
the name of Allah, with Whose name nothing on the earth or in the heavens can cause harm, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, and have anything harm
him." And Abaan had been afflicted with a bout of paralysis when a man began staring at him so Abaan said to him," What are you staring at? Did I not
inform you of the narration however I had not recited the supplication the day Allah carried out over me what is from His Divine Decree?" Related by
atTirmidhee (#3388) and Ibn Maajah (#3869), at-Tirmidhee said: It is Hasan Saheeh and al-'Alaamah Ibn Baaz (may Allah have mercy upon him) agreed with
its grade in Tuhfat-ul-Akhyaar

heading: Dua for wellness in family & property
subHeading: Dua for wellness in family & property
arabic:
اللّهُمَ اِتِّي أسْألُكَ الْعَفْوَوَ العَافِيَةَ فِى الدُّنْيَا وَالآ خِرَةِ، اللّهمَ إِّي أسْألُكَ الْعَقْوَ وَالعَافِيَةَ فِي دِيْنِي وَدُنْيَايَ وَأهْلِي
ومَالِيا للْهُمَّاسْتُرُ عَوْرَاتِيوَآمِنْ رَوْعَاتِيا للْهُمَّآحْفَظْنِي مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ وَمِنْ خَلْفِي، وَعَنْ يَمِيْنِي وَعَنْ
شِمَالِيوَ مِنْ فَوْقِي وَأعُوْذُ بِعَظْمَتِكَ أنْ أغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِي
translation:
O Allah I ask You Pardon and wellness in this life and in the hereafter, O Allah I ask You pardon and wellness in my religion, life, family and
property, O Allah hide my mistakes and make my fears peaceful. O Allah protect what is between my hands, what is behind me, what is on
my right and what is on my left, what is above me, and I seek protection in Your Magnificence that I am consumed by what is underneath
me.
refText: Related by Imaam Ahmad as #4785, Aboo Daawud as #5074 and alHaakim authenticated it in his Mustadrak as #1945 and al-'Alaamah Ibn Baaz may

heading: Daily Dua for protection
arabic:
اللَّهُمّ عَالِمَ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَاطِرَ السَّماوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ، رَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَمَلِيكهُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْلَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ،
أَعُوذُبِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ الشَّيْطَانِ وَشِرْ كِهِ، وَأَنْ أَقْتَرِفَ عَلَى نَفْسِي سُوءاً، أَوْ أَجُرَّهُ إِلَى مُسْلِمٍ
translation:
O Allaah, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things, I bear witness that
none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and
from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
refText:
Related by Ahmad (#51, #63, #81, and #7961), al-Bukhaaree in (alAdabul-Mufrad) (#1202, #1204), and in the narrative of Imaam Ahmad #7961 from him
where he said in the last part of the narration: " ... Say it when you have entered upon morning and when you have entered upon the evening, and when you
take to your bed." And it was authenticated by al- 'Alaamah Ibn Baaz-may Allah have mercy upon him-in Tuhfat-ul-Akhyaar. Taken from The Precious
Remembrance Written by ash-Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen

heading: Morning dua for protection from jinn/shaytan for the entire day [recite 100 times]
subHeading: Morning dua for protection from jinn/shaytan for the entire day [recite 100 times]
arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَحْدَهُلاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهْوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِیرُ
translation:
None has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, alone, without any partner. To Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all
things omnipotent.
refText:
It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah that the Messenger of Allaah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Whoever says [ this dua ] one hundred
times in the day, will have a reward equivalent to that of freeing ten slaves, one hundred hasanahs (good deeds) will be recorded for him, and one hundred
sayi'ahs (bad deeds) will be erased from his record, and *it will be protection for him from the Shaytaan for that day*, until evening comes. No one could
achieve any better than him except the one who does more than he did." [Ref: narrated by al-Bukhaari, 31119; Muslim, 2691]

heading: Dua against every kind of harm/evil.
subHeading: Dua against every kind of harm/evil.
arabic: حَسْبِيَ اللهُلَآ إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
translation: Allaah is Sufficient for me, none has the right to be worshipped except Him, upon Him I rely and He is Lord of the exalted throne.
refText: [Sunan Abu Dawud, Hadith No. 5081, Hassan] from hisnulmuslim.

heading: Supplications for provision / wealth
arabic: اللَّهُمَ اكفِنِي بِحَلالِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ وَأَغْنِنِي بِفَضْلِكَ عَمَّنْ سِوَاكَ
translation: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and make me independent of all others besides You.

heading: Seeking refuge from seven calamities
arabic:
اللَّهُمَ إِذِى أعُوذُبِكَ مِنَ التَّرَدَى، وَالْهَدْمِ، وَالْغَرَقِنوَ الْحَرِى قِنوَاْ عُوذُبِكَ أنْ ىَ مَخَتَّطَنِىَ الشَّى طَانُ عِنْدَ
الْمَوْتِ، وَأعُوذُبِكَ أنْ أمُوتَ فِى سَبى ِلمكَ مُدْبِراً، وَأعُوذُبِكَ أنْ أمُوتَ لَدِى خاً
translation:
O Allaah, I seek refuge with You from falling from a high place, and from being crushed by a falling building, and from drowning, and from
being burned to death, and I seek refuge with You from being overcome by Satan at the point of death, and I seek refuge with You from
dying in Your cause whilst fleeing away, and I seek refuge with You from dying from a poisonous sting'.
refText:
Imaam an-Nasaa.ee-rahimahullaah- reported in his 'Sunan' [The Book of Seeking Refuge: Chapter 61: Seeking refuge from falling from a high place, and
from being crushed by a falling building] (no. 5531): "Mahmood ibn Ghaylaan related to us, saying: al-Fadl ibn Moosaa narrated to us: from `Abdullaah ibn
Sa`eed: from Sayfee, the freed slave of Aboo Ayyoob: from Abul-Yasar, who said: Allaah's Messenger (Peace be upon him) used to say: [this dua]. Also
reported by Aboo Daawood [The Book of Prayer: Chapter 367: With regard to seeking refuge: (no.1552)]. Declared 'Saheeh' by Shaikh al-Albaanee -
rahimahullaah.

heading: Asking Allah for good deeds, and no tests
subHeading: Asking Allah for good deeds, and no tests
arabic:
اللَّهُمَّاِّي أَسأَلُكَ فِعْلَ الْخَيْرَاتِ، وَتَرْكَ الْمُنكَرَاتِ، وَحُبَّ الْمَسَاكِينِ، وَأَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِى، وَتَرْ حَمَنِي، وَإِذَا أَرَدْتَ
فِتْنَةَ قَوْمٍ فَتَوَقَّنِي غَيرَ مَفْنُونٍ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ حُبَّكَ، وَحُتَّ مَنْ يُحِبُّكَ، وَحُبَّ عَمَلٍ يُقَرِّ بُنِي إِلَى حُبِّكَ
translation:
O Allaah, I ask You to grant me the performance of good deeds, abandonment of bad ones, and love of the poor; and (I ask You) that You
forgive me and have mercy upon me; and if You intend to try a people, cause me to die without being tested; and I ask You for Your love, and
the love of those who love you, and the love of actions which draw me closer to Your love.
refText:
Ahmad 5/243, Al-Haakim 1/521 and At-Tirmidhi 5/369 (with similar wording); declared hasan by At-Tirmidhi who said, "I asked Muhammad bin Isma'il (Al-
Bukhari) and he said, "This hadith is hasan sahih." Additionally, at the end of the hadith, the Prophet alag dale alll La said, "Verily it is true so learn it and
teach it."" Source: From the Book "Supplications & Treatment with Ruqyah", Dr. Sa'eed bin Ali Al-Qahtani, Dar-us-Salam Publication

heading: Seeking refuge from weaknesses & sadness
arabic:
اللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْوذُبِكَ مِنَ الهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، والعجْرِ والكَسَلِ والبُخْلِ والجُبْنِ، وضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وغَلَبَةِ
الرِّجال
translation:
O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from | being
overcome by debt and from being overpowered by men (i .e. other people).[2]

heading: Duas for good character & personality traits
subHeading: Duas for good character & personality traits
arabic: اللَّهُمَ فَاَيّمَامُؤْ مِنٍ سَبَبْتُهُ فَاجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ لَهُ قُرْبَةً إِلَيْكَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ
translation: O Allah! If I should ever abuse a believer, please let that be a means of bringing him near to You on the Day of Resurrection.
refText:
[1] Narrated Abu Huraira: that he heard the Prophet (s) saying, "O Allah! If I should ever abuse a believer, please let that be a means of bringing him near to
You on the Day of Resurrection." Reference: Sahih al-Bukhari 6361 (Book 80, Hadith 58). Translated by Dr. Muhammad Muhsin Khan

heading: Seeking refuge from declining of favours and punishments
subHeading: Seeking refuge from declining of favours and punishments
arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُبِكَ مِنْ زَوَالِ نِعْمَتِكَ، وَتَحَوُّلِ عَافِيَتِكَ، وَفُجَاءَةِ نِقْمَتِكَ، وَجَميع سَخَطِكَ
translation:
O Allah! I seek refuge in You against the declining of Your Favours, passing of safety, the suddenness of Your punishment and all that which
displeases You).
refText: .((رواه مسلم)).[used to supplicate thus: [this dua صلى الله عليه وآله وسلم Abdullah

heading: Duas for guidance & uprightness in religion
subHeading: Duas for guidance & uprightness in religion
arabic: الَّهُمَّإِي أَعُوذُبِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ، أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ، أَوْ أُزَلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ، أَوْ أُظْلَمَ، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ، أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ
translation:
O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others, or I am misguided by others, lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err, lest I abuse
others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.
refText:
[1]Umm Salamah رضى الله عنها said, "Never did the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم leave my house without looking towards heaven, supplicating: [this dua]. " [Abu
Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi.

heading: Dua for increase & blessing in wealth and offspring
subHeading: Dua for increase & blessing in wealth and offspring
arabic:
اللَّهُمَّ أكْثِرْ مَالِى، وَوَلَدِى، وَبَارِكْلِى فِى مَا أعْطَى تَنِى وَأطِلْ حَىَ اذِى عَلَى طَاعَتِكَ، وَأحْسِنُ عَمَدِى
وَاغْفِرْلِى
translation:
O Allah, increase my wealth and offspring, and bless me in what You have given me [1] [and direct my life to Your obedience and rectify my
actions] and forgive my sins [2]
refText:
[1] Al Bukhari 7/54 and Muslim 4/1928. It is indicative of the supplicaation offered by the Prophet for Anas bin Malik where he stated "O Allah, increase his
wealth and offspring and bless him in what you have given him.

heading: A comprehensive dua
arabic:
اللَّهُمَ إِنِي أَسْأَلُكَ الثَّبَاتَ فِي الأَمْرِ، وَالْعَزِيمَةَ عَلَى الرُّشْدِ، وَأَسْأَلكَ مُوجِبَاتِ رَحْمَتِكَ، وَعَزَابِمَ مَغْفِرَتِكَ،
وَأَسْأَلُكَ شُكْرَ نِعْمَنِكَ، وَحُسْنَ عِبَادَتِكَ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ قَلْبَاً سَلِيمَاً، وَلِسَانَاً صَادِقَاً، وَأَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِْ مَا تَعْلَمُ،
وَأَعُوذُبِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا تَعْلَمُ، وَأَسْتَغْفِرُكَ لِمَا تَعْلَمُ، إِنَّكَ أنْتَ عَلاَّمُ الْغُيُوبِ
translation:
O Allaah verily I ask of You for strength of perseverance of obedience on the Deen, and determination in practicing of the Deen and
goodness. And I ask of You for that which obligates Your mercy and resolutions for Your forgiveness. And I ask of You for the capability to
be thankful for Your blessings and to worship you in a correct and good way. And I ask of You for a heart which is purified in belief and free
from desires and a truthful tongue. And ask of You for the best of what You know, and I seek refuge with You from the evil of what You know
and I seek forgiveness for that which You know. Indeed You are the One who knows the unseen.
refText:
Collected by Tabraani in 'Mu'ajam al-Kabeer' (7/335-336), Abu Na'eem in 'al-Hileeyah' (1/266), Ibn Aasakir in 'Tareekh Damishk'. Albaani said this Isnaad is
Jayyid, in 'Silsilah Saheehah' No. 3228.

heading: Dua for healing and good health
subHeading: Dua for healing and good health
arabic: اللَّهُمَ ربَّ النَّاسِ، أَذْهِب الْبَأسَ، واشْفِ، أَنْتَ الشَّافي لا شِفَاءَ إِلاَّ شِفَاؤُكَ، شِفاءَ لا يُغَادِرُ سقَماً
translation:
O Allaah, Lord of mankind, do away with my suffering. Heal (me) as You are the only Healer and there is no cure except that of Yours, it is
that which leaves no ailment behind
refText:
(Al Bukhari (with Al-Fath 10/206) and Muslim 4/1721) Source: From the Book "Supplications & Treatment with Ruqyah (Pocket size)" - Dr. Sa'eed bin Ali Al-
Qahtani - Dar-us-Salam Publication

heading: Duas for paradise and refuge from hellfire
subHeading: Duas for paradise and refuge from hellfire
arabic:
اللَّهُمَ إِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ، وَمَا قَزَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ، وَأَعُوذُبِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ
عَمَلٍ
translation:
O Allaah, I ask of You for Paradise and that which brings me closer to it of statements or actions. And I seek refuge with You from the
Hellfire and that which takes me closer to it of statements or actions.
refText: Authenticated by Albaani in Saheeh Ibn Majah 2/327

heading: Dua for a submissive heart and satisfied soul, and answered prayers
subHeading: Dua for a submissive heart and satisfied soul, and answered prayers
arabic: اللَّهُمّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُبِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ لَا يَنْفَعُ وَمِنْ قَلْبٍ لا يَخْشَعُ وَمِنْ نَفْسِ لَا تَشْبَعُ وَمِنْ دَعْوَةِلَا يُسْتَجَابُ لَهَا
translation:
O Allah, I seek refuge with You from knowledge that does not benefit, from a heart that is not humbly submissive; from a soul that is never
satisfied, and from a supplication that is not given a response.

heading: Seeking refuge with Allah from evil people around you
subHeading: Seeking refuge with Allah from evil people around you
arabic:
اللهَمَّ إِّي أَعُوْذُبِكَ مِنْ جَارِ السُّوءِ، وَمِنْ زَوْج تَشَتِّبَنِي قَبْلَ الْمَشِيْبِ، وَمِنْ وَلَدٍ يَكُونُ عَلَيَّرَبَاً، وَمِنْ مَالِ
يَكُونُ عَلَيَّ عَذَاباً،وَمِنْ خَلِيْلٍ مَاكِرِ عَيِنُهُ تَرَانِيٍ، وَقَلْبُهُ يَرعَانِي؛ إنْ رَأَى حَسَنَةً دَفَنَهَا، وَإذَارَأَى سَيِّنَةً
أَذَاعَهَا
translation:
Oh Allaah, I seek refuge with you from an evil neighbour; and from a wife who causes me to grow old before old age; and from a son who will
become a master over me; and from wealth which will become a punishment for me; and from a cunning friend whose gaze is upon me &
whose heart is plotting & planning against me, such that if he sees something good, he buries it & if he sees something bad he spreads it.
refText:
Abu Hurayrah (radee'Allaahu anhu) said that from his (Messenger of Allaah, sallAllaahu alayhee wa aalehee wasalam) supplications were [this dua]
(Collected by At Tabaraani in 'Ad Dua' (3/1425/1339) and its chain is declared 'Jayyid' (Good) by Shaikh Al Albaani in silsilatul Ahaadeethus Saheehah
(No#3137)

heading: Dua for protection from harm/jinn/shayateen
arabic:
أَعُوذُ بكَلِمَاتِ اللهِالتَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُهُنَّبَرُّ ولَا فَاجرُ مِنْ شَرِّ مَاخَلقَ، وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ، ومِنْ شَرِّمَا
يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُ جُ فيهَا، ومِن شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ في الأَرْضِ ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُ جُ مِنْهَا، وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ
اللَّيْلِ والنَّهارِ،ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طَارِقٍ إِلَّا طَارٍ قاً يَطْرُقُ بخَيْرٍ يَارَحْمَنُ
translation:
I take refuge within Allaah's perfect words which no righteous or unrighteous person can transgress, from all the evil that He has created,
made and originated. [I take refuge] from the evil that descends from the sky and the evil that rises up to it. [I take refuge] from the evil that
is spread on earth and the evil that springs from her, and I take refuge from the evil of the tribulations of night and day, and the evil of one
who visits at night except the one who brings good, O Merciful One.'
refText:
Ja'far bin Sulaymaan ad-Duba'ee narrated: Aboo at-Tayyaaj narrated to us, he said: "I said to 'Abdur-Rahmaan bin Khanbash at-Tameemee - and he was an
old man - 'did you reach the Messenger of Allaah alu9 dule alll Lo (during his lifetime)?' He said, 'Yes.' He said: 'So I said: How did the Messenger of
Allaah ol9 dle alll gLo act on the night the shayaateen plotted against him?' So he said: 'Indeed the shayaateen descended that night upon the Messenger
of Allaah ola9 dile alll Lo from the valleys and mountain paths, and amongst them was a shaytaan, in his hand was a flame of fire, wanting to burn the face

heading: Anxiety and sorrow
arabic:
اللّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْوذُبِكَ مِنَ الهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، والعَجْزِ والكَسَلِ والبُخْلِ والجُبِْنِ، وضَلْعِ الدَّيْنِ وغَلَبَةِ
الرِّجال
translation:
O Allah, I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being
overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i .e . others).

heading: Supplication for one in distress
arabic: لا إِلهَ إِلا آنَت سُبْحانَك إِني كنّتَ مِنَ الظالِمين
translation: There is none worthy of worship but You, glory is to You. Surely, I was among the wrongdoers.[3]
refText: At-Tirmithi 5/529. Al-Hakim declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/ 505. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/168.

heading: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority
subHeading: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority
arabic: اللّهُمَّ أَنْتَ عَضُدي، وَأَنْتَ نَصيري، بِكَ أَجولُ وَبِكَ أَصولُ وَبِكَ أُقاتِل
translation: O Allah, You are my strength and You are my support. For Your sake I go forth and for Your sake I advance and for Your sake I fight.
refText: Abu Dawud 2/89, and Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 2/142

heading: Supplication for one afflicted with doubt in his faith
subHeading: Supplication for one afflicted with doubt in his faith
arabic: هُوَ الأوَّلُ، وَالآخِرُ، وَالظّاهِرُ، وَالْباطِنُ، وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليم
translation: He is the First and the Last, the Most High and the Most Near. And He is the Knower of all things.
refText: Hadid 57:3; Abu Dawud 4/329. Declared hasan by Al-Albaanee and al-Arna'uut

heading: Settling a debt
arabic:
اللّهُمَّ إِنِي أَعْوذُبِكَ مِنَ الهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، والعَجْزِ والكَسَلِ والبُخْلِ والجُبْنِ، وضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وغَلَبَةِ
الرِّجال
translation:
O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from | being
overcome by debt and from being overpowered by men (i .e. other people).[2]

heading: Supplication for a child in the funeral prayer
subHeading: Supplication for a child in the funeral prayer
arabic: اللهُمِّ اجْعَلْهُ لَنا فَرَطاً، وَسَلَفاً وَأَجْراً
translation: O Allah, make him for us a precursor, a forerunner and a cause of reward.
refText: Ibn Qudamah, Al-Mughni 3/416 and Ad-Duroosul-Muhimmah li-Aammatil-'Ummah, pg. 15, by Shaikh 'Abdul-'Aziz bin Baz.

heading: Supplication Condolence
arabic: أَعْظَمَ اللهُ أَجْرَكَ، وَأَحْسَنَ عَزاءَ كَ، وَغَفَرَ لِمَيِّتِكَ
translation: May Allah magnify your reward, and make perfect your bereavement, and forgive your departed[2]

heading: Visiting the graves
arabic: العافِيَة
translation:
Peace be upon you, people of this abode, from among the believers and those who are Muslims, and we, by the Will of Allah, shall be
joining you . [May Allah have mercy on the first of us and the last of us] I ask Allah to grant us and you strength.
refText: Muslim 2/671, Ibn Majah 1/494, the portion brackets is from Muslim 2/671.

heading: What to say and do when feeling some pain in the body
subHeading: What to say and do when feeling some pain in the body
arabic: أَعُوذُ باللهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ
translation: I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.

heading: The last 3 Surahs of the Quran
subHeading: The last 3 Surahs of the Quran
arabic: بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ ﴾ قُلْ هُوَ اللهُ أَحَدٌ ﴾ اللهُ الصَّمَدُ ﴾ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًّا أَحَدٌهه
translation:
With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures
need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him. [Surah Ikhlas]

heading: The last 3 Surahs of the Quran
subHeading: The last 3 Surahs of the Quran
arabic:
